introduction.p: A good bug description often leads a software developer straight to the cause of the bug. Unlike the name of the bug which gives a one-line description of the bug, the description includes a great deal of detail. The bug pattern for each listed bug usually has a fairly well fleshed out description. Use the guidelines below to fill in blank sections or add to it.

warning.p: It is the developer's job to debug - avoid the temptation to dig too deeply!

guidelines.p: Here are some guidelines for describing bugs:

ul.li: Tell about any extra steps you performed.
Tell about any steps you omitted.

Write about the order in which you executed steps leading to the failure
To see if the order of steps is significant, execute the steps in different orders.
Write about any behaviors not listed in the result.
If you know something about programming, it's OK to guess at a general cause by phrases such as, "acts like a pointer is not initialized", but don't fail to tell why you feel that way.
